original_solution_mapping.L2: Therefore, there will be 2 x 160 = <<2*160=320>>320 runners this year.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2271.
    Returns: the number of people who will run this year.
    """
    # L1
    signed_up_last_year = 200 # 200 people signed up
    no_show_last_year = 40 # Forty people did not show up to run
    runners_last_year = signed_up_last_year - no_show_last_year

    # L2
    multiplier_this_year = 2 # twice as many runners
    runners_this_year = multiplier_this_year * runners_last_year

    # FA
    answer = runners_this_year
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Therefore, there will be {multiplier_this_year} x {runners_last_year} = <<{multiplier_this_year}*{runners_last_year}={runners_this_year}>>{runners_this_year} runners this year.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Therefore, there will be 40 x 160 = <<40*160=6400>>6400 runners this year.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'no_show_last_year' (40) was used instead of 'multiplier_this_year' (2).
